page.title: 11CUSWORTH HALL
page.content: Cusworth Hall is a museum open to the public.It has rooms which display Victorian costume, furniture, kitchen and washing equipment. Other rooms hold items which tell the story of mining and other local industries. The Museum holds open days when children can take part in different activities. The grounds are a Public Park where people can have picnics, play games, stroll around or even fish in the lakes. Also in the grounds is a Cricket Field used by local teams. It became a Museum in 1961. In 1669 the Wrightsons bought the house and land to make money. William Wrightson bought village houses as well. In the 1740's William Wrightson decided to build the hall, as it is now. There is a gate house at the entrance which used to be two little cottages.
